title: Double slit - fringe spacing for 2x lambda and 2d

content.description: Two double-slit experiments are performed using different light sources and different arrangements of slits. In the resulting interference patterns, small-angle approximations are valid.
content.question: In the first experiment, light of wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is incident upon a pair of slits that are a distance <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> apart. In the interference pattern formed on a screen some distance from the slits, the distance from the central bright maximum to the adjacent bright maximum is <math alttext="y sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In the second experiment, light of wavelength <math alttext="2 lambda sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is incident upon a pair of slits that are a distance <math alttext="2 d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> apart. In the interference pattern formed on a screen that is the same distance from the slits as in the first experiment, the distance from the central bright maximum to the adjacent bright maximum is <math alttext="y sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is <math alttext="y sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="y sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times y sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
